newsitem.title: USA: Harte-Hanks to buy data marketing company.
newsitem.headline: Harte-Hanks to buy data marketing company.

text.p: Harte-Hanks Communications Inc said Wednesday that it had agreed to buy Marketing Communications Inc, a Kansas City provider of integrated database marketing services.

Harte-Hanks said it will pay about $33 million in cash and short term notes for the stock of Marketing Communications. The company has 300 employees and is expected to have about $28 million in revenue for the year ended December 31, Harte-Hanks said.
The deal should close in November.
Harte-Hanks said the company will become part of its direct marketing division and that it plans to retain Marketing Communications' management team.
